name: Westin New Orleans Canal Place

reviews.text: Stayed here for LSU Bama BCS game. It's a wonderful location for tourist sites in the French Quarter. Ask for a room with river view which is spectacular.
reviews.title: Great location, needs updating

reviews.text: Service was ok. Rooms were good, not great. Common areas, gym and elevators are in need of update.
reviews.title: Great property, convenient location

reviews.text: Stayed here on business recently and was pleasantly surprised at this hotel. It was extremely well set, very nice rooms and very clean. Had a room overlooking the river which was nice. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was very clean. The location is very convenient, being connected to a mall, and within walking distance of the business district and right across the street from Harrah's Casino. Ordered room service one night and had the shrimp po-boy which was surprisingly really tasty! Used the workout room a few times and it's decent. They have a few treadmills, stationary bikes and a stair machine. They also have a fair amount of free weights. No complaints at all about this place and would definitely stay here again, whether it's for business or personal.
reviews.title: nice hotel, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read a number of reviews, I was a bit concerned that this hotel wasn't that nice. But it is. The location is fabulous, the rooms are fine and the staff is great. The only constructive observation I would make is that they really should clean the carpets in the corridors. We were on 21, and the carpet was stained and really should be replaced, it looked rather dirty. But our room was very clean.
reviews.title: We loved this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have visited New Orleans more than 40 times, and we have always stayed at the smaller, older hotels that have the old New Orleans ambiance. On a recent trip to New Orleans, we chose the Westin only because the price was much less than most of the other hotels were charging due to a Saints game. I was prepared not to like this hotel because I knew it would be so much different than the type of hotel we always stay at in New Orleans.
reviews.title: Would Not Stay Again

reviews.text: Nice Hotel but could use some updating... This is a large hotel attached to the Canal Place Shops and easy walking distance to the French Quarter. I have stayed here many times and always have good service. The rooms could use some small updates as in painting and slight touch ups but other than that it is a good hotel in NOLA. I do wish they would turn down the Westin Scent that is pumped throughout the lobby... it can be overpowering.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but could use some updating

reviews.text: The helpful and courteous staff made my check-in painless, and they honored my request for a room as far away from the elevator as possible. Room 2629 faced the CBD and had a nice skyline view. The curtains did a very good job of blocking out light while still opening to reveal a nice sized window. I know people complain about the dual elevator thing, but once you've done it a time or two it's really not that big of a deal. I liked how logical the maid staff was; when they saw you leave in the morning, they'd come right over and clean your room almost immediately. If you came back in 90 minutes, it'd be done, quickly and neatly.
reviews.title: A nice experience, slightly marred by a few small issues

reviews.text: Now, the few slightly negative points: You really have to be careful crossing N. Peters St. when walking back to the hotel from the Quarter, because New Orleans drivers don't respect the whole "pedestrian in the crosswalk" thing; they just whizz right by. (That's hardly the hotel's fault, but I thought you might want to take it into account when choosing your accommodations.) The room's TV was a little small and was either standard definition or only receiving a standard definition signal; in my view, that's a little subpar for a hotel of this class and quality. The Heavenly bed wasn't all that heavenly, but I'm also a Tempurpedic person so that probably colors my perspective on the issue. When you exit on the Iberville side, you feel a touch removed from everything because you're almost back by the streetcar tracks, but the location probably merits a 4.5/5 considering how easily accessed the Quarter and Canal Street are.
reviews.title: Stunning location with river views and dog friendly!.

reviews.text: So overall, this was a legitimate four star experience. By the way, I got the room comped through Harrah's Total Rewards. Apparently the Harrah's hotel is very small so they have partner properties up and down Canal Street. If you happen to do a little gambling in Vegas or Atlantic City or wherever, it's probably worth logging into your Total Rewards and seeing if they'll hook you up. I'm not at a very high level with them and still got the room free with no taxes or fees, so hopefully that will work for you as well.
reviews.title: My go to hotel

reviews.text: We stayed on points and were upgraded to a room on 28 floor - amazing views. A Heavely Dog Bed was provided for our 4lb Yorkie! The Fitness Center was an unusually great hotel gym with lots of equipment all in good working order. Swimming pool on roof with beautiful views in all directions. Staff very attentive, friendly, happy and genuinely wanting to please. Go to Cafe Beignet for wonderful coffee and Beignets (much nicer than the famous Cafe Du Monde.
reviews.title: Great location, good rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first time in New Orleans and at a Westin Hotel. The hotel is located steps from the riverwalk, across the street from Harrah's casino and a short walk from the French Quarter. The lobby is located on the 11th floor which I'm not sure if that's the norm for New Orleans style hotels, but check in was a breeze and the staff was pleasant. After check in, we had to take a different set of elevators to our room. Some of the elevators required you to swipe your room key to get to your floor. We stayed in a King guest room which was large and clean. The shower was nice with adequate water pressure, only drawback is the lack of of a fan in the bathroom to clear all the steam.
reviews.title: Overall good hotel in a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a great stay at the Westin Canal Place. The location is excellent connected to the mall and across from the casino and French Quarter. The rooms are comfortable and well appointed. The breakfast buffet in the resturaunt 11 floors above the Mississippi is not to be missed. It's very close to the House of Blues, Arnaud's, Mr. B's Bistro, The views of the hotel overlooking the river are excellent.
reviews.title: Great stay over New Years 2012

reviews.text: We went to New Orleans for the holidays and got a terrific rate at the Westin - and we couldn't have been more pleased. The location on the edge of the French Quarter is perfect, and the staff was the most service oriented and accommodating I've ever had. Just a great experience.
reviews.title: Great view, great location, great stay

reviews.text: Took our daughter to New Orleans between Christmas and New Years as a Christmas gift. New Orleans is not my favorite tourist location so I may be more critical than usual. I think the food is expensive and often overrated. The crowds are thick. The streets are dirty.
reviews.title: It could have been worse

reviews.text: the panhandlers are everywhere. The service is slow and listless. Other than that .... I can't complain. But, I digress ... this is a review of the hotel not New Orleans.
reviews.title: Disappointed in this Westin

reviews.text: Perched above the Mississippi River, the Westin's river-view rooms give you close proximity to the French Quarter, but the added benefit of being quiet and with an awesome view of the river traffic and a birds-eye view of the entire French Quarter. We are on the 27th floor and this is as good as it gets. Even get to have our dog with us, with his own heavenly bed.
reviews.title: The Best Room in The Big Easy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I guess it really depends on what you're looking for. If you want good location and nice view, the hotel is fine. If you're looking for an upper class hotel, with efficient service, properly trained staff, clean rooms and commodities, properly running elevators, and good room service, then just avoid the place.
reviews.title: Very disappointing

reviews.text: We had a suite on 28th floor and had to complain up to the general manager to simply get the room cleaned properly the plumbing repaired, a fresh bathrobe and an adaptor for the electrical plug. It took 4 days to finall get it. Unacceptable.
reviews.title: Location, location

reviews.text: Rugs are worn, furnitures's in bad condition, 1 elevator out if 4 was working, etc. so for a Westin, it was really really bad although the General Manager did try to get things fixed.
reviews.title: The rooms are Spotless and Large!!

reviews.text: And by the way, this is the 3rd day we're waiting for our laundry to be returned. We're leaving tomorrow. Wish us luck!
reviews.title: Great location for first stay.

aka: Westin New Orleans Canal Place Hotel New Orleans
description: The Westin New Orleans Canal Place is downtown just steps from the French Quarter, the Convention Center, Jackson Square, and the central business district. Offering a rooftop pool and free wifi.
